You are given a string.  A string is called a *k*-palindrome if it is a palindrome itself, and its prefix and suffix of length $(k-1)$ are also palindromes.  For example, "abaaba" has a palindrome degree of 3.

Find the sum of the palindrome degrees of all prefixes of the given string.
Given a string, find the sum of the maximum lengths of prefixes that are palindromes themselves and have palindromic prefixes and suffixes of length one less.
